metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the ind-def:textfilecontent_test is properly supported.
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the ind-def:textfilecontent_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the textfilecontent_object with a path, filename, and line is supported.
Test that the textfilecontent_object with a path pattern match, filename, and line is supported.
Test that the textfilecontent_object with a path, filename pattern match, and line is supported.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for a limited depth of recursion.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for a unlimited depth of recursion.
Test that the recurse_direction behavior is supported.

textfilecontent_test.comment: Test that the textfilecontent_object with a path, filename, and line is supported.
Test that the textfilecontent_object with a path pattern match, filename, and line is supported.
Test that the textfilecontent_object with a path, filename pattern match, and line is supported.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for a limited depth of recursion.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported for a unlimited depth of recursion.
Test that the recurse_direction behavior is supported.

textfilecontent_object.comment: This textfilecontent_object retrieves all lines that match the regular expression 'OVAL Interpreter' in the file where the path equals '/tmp/support/txt/txtfile' and the filename equals 'build.win32.txt'.

This textfilecontent_object retrieves all lines that match the regular expression 'OVAL Interpreter' in the file where the path matches the regular expression '^/tmp/support.+' and the filename equals 'build.win32.txt'.

This textfilecontent_object retrieves all lines that match the regular expression 'OVAL Interpreter' in the file where the path equals '/tmp/support/txt/txtfile' and the filename matches the regular expression 'build.win[0-9]{2}\.txt'.

This textfilecontent_object retrieves all lines that match the regular expression 'OVAL Interpreter' in the file where the path equals '/tmp/support/txt', recursing down one level, and the filename equals 'build.win32.txt'.

This textfilecontent_object retrieves all lines that match the regular expression 'OVAL Interpreter' in the file where the path equals '/tmp/support', recursing down infinitely, and the filename equals 'build.win32.txt'.

This textfilecontent_object retrieves all lines that match the regular expression 'OVAL Interpreter' in the file where the path equals '/tmp/support/txt/txtfile/subtxtfile', recursing up one level, and the filename equals 'build.win32.txt'.

textfilecontent_state.comment: This textfilecontent_state represents a textfilecontent_item where the path equals '/tmp/support/txt/txtfile', filename equals 'build.win32.txt', and line matches the regular expression 'OVAL Interpreter'.

This textfilecontent_state represents a textfilecontent_item where the path equals '/tmp/support/txt/txtfile', filename equals 'build.win32.txt', and line matches the regular expression 'OVAL Interpreter'.
